byline.contributor: Joe Cochrane contributed reporting from Jakarta, Indonesia; Ellen Barry from New Delhi; and Weiyi Lim from Singapore.

abstract: Bangladesh government charges 14 Bangladeshi construction workers who had been  deported from Singapore for suspected links with Islamic militants; deportation is unwelcome development for Bangladesh, where government and families depend heavily on money sent home from hundreds of thousands of contract workers in Malaysia, Singapore and other countries.

headline.print_headline: Terrorism Charges Filed in Bangladesh Against 14 Men
headline.main: Terrorism Charges in Bangladesh for 14 Men Deported From Singapore

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A group of men deported on suspicion of involvement with militant networks were charged, though Bangladesh said there was no evidence that they were planning an attack.
lead_paragraph: A group of men deported on suspicion of involvement with militant networks were charged, though Bangladesh said there was no evidence that they were planning an attack.
